 There seems to be confusion as to the differences in physical discipline and physical child abuse. Those adults who were mistreated as a child (and I’m referring to harsh treatment – beatings) tend to classify spankings as beatings.
 Children are different. They have different temperaments/characters. Those who are more rebellious require harsher discipline. But, it is the parent’s responsibility to take the time to teach them in a loving manner, even though it requires them to take a slice out of their busy schedule.
 The answers are not cut and dried – too many variables. But seeing a parent tug on a child is not the same as one who jerks the child along. Whether it is socially acceptable or not, some forms of physical discipline is required.
